Ididn't know about that there was one in Cocoa Bch. I do know about Ashley's in Rockledge. 
  What is the story about Deke Slayton???

Guy <yzzzguy@...> wrote:
          Hello, Ben. I lived in Melbourne (specifically Palm Bay) for 3 
years...1980 to 1983. Watched some of the first shuttle launches from 
the back door of my apartment. [saw the first night launch off one of 
the Cape's causeways] I was back there for a few days last year for 
business (I used to work for Harris and I was a temporary liason for 
Boeing for a piece of equipment that Harris was building for the C-130 
modernization program).

Have you ever investigated that allegedly haunted restaurant up in 
Cocoa Beach that the late author Martin Caidin used to check out? I 
don't remember the name right off the top of my head but his friend - 
parapsychologist Loyd Auerbach - wrote about it in one of his books. 
I'll look it up for you.

Please keep in touch as you might be able to assist me in verifying a 
moderern day ghost story concerning the late Mercury astronaut Deke 
Slayton.

Guy Jackson
Huntington Beach, CA

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "benjamin tait" <paulbearer666200@...> 
wrote:
>
> I am so glad that Misty sent me this link. Anywho...My name is Ben 
and 
> I am the founder of The Melbourne Paranormal Foundation. Me and my 
> group are based here in Melbourne ,FL and I have known Misty for over 
2 
> years now. I personally have been interested in the paranormal ever 
> sence my 1st experence with it when I was 10 years old or so. I hope 
to 
> meet some of y'all soon and I hope that we ALL can openly share our 
> experences.
>
